trial_identification.studytitle: Comparison of success rate, speed of insertion and acute complication rates of central venous catheter (CVC) insertion between using ultrasound guidance technique and traditional anatomical landmark technique in elective surgery
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Comparison of success rate, speed of insertion and acute complication rates of central venous catheter (CVC) insertion between using ultrasound guidance technique and traditional anatomical landmark technique in elective surgery

conditions.healthcondition: Elective surgery with planned central venous catheter (CVC) insertion

interventions.interventions: Central venous catheter (CVC) insertion by using ultrasound guidance technique in the immediate perioperative period of elective surgery
interventions.comparator: Central venous catheter (CVC) insertion by using traditional anatomical landmark technique in the immediate perioperative period of elective surgery

primaryOutcome.outcome: Success rate of CVC insertion during perioperative period
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At time of insertion and chest X-ray assessment that occurs within 24 hour

primaryOutcome.outcome: Speed of CVC insertion during perioperative period
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At time of insertion and chest X-ray assessment that occurs within 24 hour
At time of insertion and chest X-ray assessment that occurs within 24 hour

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients for elective planned CVC in operating theatres.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Unplanned CVC insertion. Known difficult CVC insertion or neck abnormality.

trial_design.sequence: Computer generated block permuted block randomisation

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Department of Anaesthesia, St Vincent's Hospital , Melbourne

ethicsAndSummary.summary: A prospective randomised controlled trial to assess the potential benefits and acute complication rates of ultrasound guided CVC insertion with traditional anatomical landmark insertion technique

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Victorian Department of Human Services, Human Research Ethics Committee

contact.name: Lisa Chih-Mei Lin
contact.address: Department of Anaesthesia St Vincent's Hospital 41 Victoria Parade Fitzroy VIC 3065

contact.name: Lisa Chih-Mei Lin
contact.address: Department of Anaesthesia St Vincent's Hospital 41 Victoria Parade Fitzroy VIC 3065
